intro: Dorstenia cuspidata var. debilis, commonly known as the weak-stemmed woolly cucumber, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces green, fleshy fruits that resemble cucumbers, which are edible when mature. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique appearance and growth habits make it a distinctive species within its genus.
